title: Simulation-Based Neonatal Airway Management Expert Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic neonatal nursing and emergency care knowledge
context.additional_context: A re-education program for professionals operated by a medical device company, conducted in simulation facilities that closely resemble real clinical environments.

learning_goals: Perform neonatal airway management procedures (intubation, bag-mask ventilation, upper airway management) with ≥85% accuracy in simulation environments
Identify ≥3 potential complications (side effects, equipment malfunctions) during neonatal airway management and explain response protocols
Apply communication protocols in team-based simulations to achieve effective role distribution in ≥4 out of 5 attempts

resources: Digital video recording and analysis system

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
